timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change data: title: Google Cloud Functions examples description: |

Examples of Google Cloud HTTP and Background Functions for Quarkus.

You don't need this as data in that case, above, I've suggested to put it directly in the README.md

timeline.bodyText:
Sorry I missed that you didn't add the extension binding in the descriptor metadata:
https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/master/extensions/google-cloud-functions/runtime/src/main/resources/META-INF/quarkus-extension.yaml
codestart: google-cloud-functions
(This is what trigger the codestart activation when the extension is selected)
I am not sure if the binding should be on google-cloud-functions or google-cloud-functions-http (or both)
timeline.author: ia3andy

replies.bodyText:
It's google-cloud-functions only, I'll provide a separate PR for HTTP binding and for funqy.
I added it in the corresponing quarkus-extension.yaml file.
By the way, this step is missing from the documentation: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/tree/master/independent-projects/tools/codestarts
replies.author: loicmathieu

replies.bodyText:
Weird the adoc rendering is not working, it was working fine a few weeks ago..
@loicmathieu it is :) look at the "When done (to bind the extension codestart to the actual extension)" section
replies.author: ia3andy

replies.bodyText:

This deserve a little code snippet from an extension :)
